meanings.definition: A type of head covering, typically worn by Roman Catholic clergy.
meanings.sent1: The priest wore his calottes during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The bishop's calottes matched his robes perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The calottes of the nuns fluttered in the wind as they walked.
meanings.sent4: The calottes of the clergy symbolized their devotion to God.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the calottes made them stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: A small metal cap used in electrical engineering.
meanings.sent1: The technician carefully placed the calottes on the circuit board.
meanings.sent2: The calottes were essential for protecting the electrical connections.
meanings.sent3: The calottes gleamed under the bright lights of the lab.
meanings.sent4: The calottes conducted electricity efficiently, ensuring smooth operation.
meanings.sent5: The calottes were like tiny guardians of the electronic components.

meanings.definition: A dome-shaped structure, such as the top of a building or a helmet.
meanings.sent1: The calottes of the cathedral towered over the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The knight's helmet had a shiny calottes at the very top.
meanings.sent3: The calottes of the observatory looked like giant bubbles in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The calottes of the castle provided a majestic silhouette against the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The calottes of the dome added an elegant touch to the architecture.
